alert.note: Alert for Lower Garfield and Asotin Counties (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 20 at 1:32AM PST until February 20 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the first Wind Advisory, southwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. For the second Wind Advisory, southwest winds 20 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected with locally higher speeds possible around Alpowa Summit. * WHERE...Alpowa Summit, Clarkston, and Pomeroy. * WHEN...For the first Wind Advisory, until 10 AM PST this morning. For the second Wind Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to 10 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result.
info.instruction: Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Use extra caution.
